text:
e="preserve">Finn Christian "Finken" Jagge (4 April 1966 – 8 July 2020) was a Norwegian Alpine skier. He was the son of alpine skier Liv Jagge and tennis player Finn Dag Jagge.
In the World Cup he won seven slalom victories. He also won the Norwegian Championship 8 times. His career highlight came with the gold medal in the slalom competition at the 1992 Olympics in Albertville. He represented Bærums SK, and retired in 2000. He was born in Oslo.
Jagge died on 8 July 2020 from volvulus, aged 54.
